poem:
### Feast

Muffled clatter in kitchens,
a rebirth in recipes—
touchscreens hum like bees
over blossoms of code.  
Silent alchemy, turning  
dusty feeds to sustenance  
for the hungry heart,  
curated and contained.  
In this digital hearth,  
an ancient art unfolds,  
tasting of memories  
unseen, yet savored.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Cooking up recipe data for the Feast app You may have heard the Guardian has a new cooking app called Feast. With thousands of searchable recipes, cook mode, and lots of other lovely features, it’s been well received on both iOS and Android. You should definitely get it. No article on its own could possibly do justice to the work that’s gone into making Feast a reality (a big book might be able to pull". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
